Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This Workflow syncs customers from Shopify to Sage Intacct. 
It begins by retrieving customer data from Shopify and iterates through each record. 
For every customer, it checks if it exists in a Key Value Group (SageCustomers) with the Customer ID being the Key. 
If the customer does not exist, the Workflow maps the data, creates the customer in Sage Intacct, and logs the outcome—whether successful or an error. 
If the customer exists, the Formatter Node displays a message.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Group for Key Values

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we display a message if the Customer ID has been found in the Key Values

Properties.Name: Expression
Properties.Value: Customer ID: "{CustomerID}" has already been processed.

Nodes.Name: ShopifyRest
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are retrieving a list of customers from Shopify—limited to one record as specified by the 'limit' Custom Property.

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we split the full Customer List from Shopify into individual customer records

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the Customer ID has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this Customer ID.

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we map the customer data retrieved from Shopify to the Sage Intacct format before creating the customer record in Sage.
Both JSON and XML document types are utilized in this step.

Nodes.Name: SageIntacct
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are creating the Customer record in Sage Intacct

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Request">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="CUSTOMER">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="CUSTOMERID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="NAME" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="DISPLAYCONTACT">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="PRINTAS" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="COMPANYNAME" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="TAXABLE" type="xs:boolean" />
                    <xs:element name="TAXGROUP" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="PREFIX" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="FIRSTNAME" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="LASTNAME" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="INITIAL" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="PHONE1" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
                    <xs:element name="PHONE2" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
                    <xs:element name="CELLPHONE" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
                    <xs:element name="PAGER" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
                    <xs:element name="FAX" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
                    <xs:element name="EMAIL1" />
                    <xs:element name="EMAIL2" />
                    <xs:element name="URL1" />
                    <xs:element name="URL2" />
                    <xs:element name="MAILADDRESS">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="ADDRESS1" type="xs:string" />
                          <xs:element name="ADDRESS2" type="xs:string" />
                          <xs:element name="CITY" type="xs:string" />
                          <xs:element name="STATE" type="xs:string" />
                          <xs:element name="ZIP" type="xs:unsignedInt" />
                          <xs:element name="COUNTRY" type="xs:string" />
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="ONETIME" type="xs:boolean" />
              <xs:element name="STATUS" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="HIDEDISPLAYCONTACT" type="xs:boolean" />
              <xs:element name="CUSTTYPE" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="PARENTID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="GLGROUP" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="TERRITORYID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="SUPDOCID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="TERMNAME" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OFFSETGLACCOUNTNO" type="xs:unsignedShort" />
              <xs:element name="ARACCOUNT" type="xs:unsignedShort" />
              <xs:element name="SHIPPINGMETHOD" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="RESALENO" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
              <xs:element name="TAXID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="CREDITLIMIT" type="xs:decimal" />
              <xs:element name="ONHOLD" type="xs:boolean" />
              <xs:element name="DELIVERY_OPTIONS" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="CUSTMESSAGEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="COMMENTS" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="CURRENCY" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="ARINVOICEPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OEQUOTEPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OEORDERPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OELISTPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OEINVOICEPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OEADJPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="OEOTHERPRINTTEMPLATEID" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="CONTACTINFO">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="CONTACTNAME" type="xs:string" />
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="BILLTO">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="CONTACTNAME" type="xs:string" />
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="SHIPTO">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="CONTACTNAME" type="xs:string" />
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="OBJECTRESTRICTION" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="RESTRICTEDLOCATIONS" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="RESTRICTEDDEPARTMENTS" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="CUSTOMFIELD1" type="xs:string" />
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: Request

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are checking if the Customer was created successfully in Sage Intacct by filtering on the status field.

A successful Sage Response looks as follows:
<Response>
  <result>
    <status>success</status>
    <function>create</function>
    <controlid>638859300410961774</controlid>
    <data listtype="objects" count="1">
      <customer>
        <RECORDNO>1629</RECORDNO>
        <CUSTOMERID>9037440024123</CUSTOMERID>
      </customer>
    </data>
  </result>
</Response>

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for successful records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Sage Intacct Response Status as the Value.

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for error records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Sage Intacct Response Status as the Value.

Name: Shopify To Sage Intacct Customers
Description: This Workflow syncs customers from Shopify to Sage Intacct by retrieving and processing each record individually. It checks for existing customers in a Key Value Group and creates new ones in Sage Intacct if needed, logging the result for each.
